text: I’m pretty sure when this happened, I could re enable it in the design manager, you just have to look for this toggle in the fields / field groups
<@UDJV5B73R> I appreciate you having a look. I checked that area you mentioned first.  The module doesn't include it. It looks like this.

It may have changed since the last time I did it, but I think I had to actually click through to the different field group or field settings to find the setting, which I guess would mean it’s in the module’s fields.json rather than the meta.json

Have you tried these 3 things?
1. remove module from template. Publish, then add it back and publish.
2. try to give the module a new unique id in hubl – ex: `{% module 'new_uniq_instance_name' ... %}`
3. make sure you aren’t using global partial tags if you are calling it via custom code

Hey <@U3T21PDBK> Thanks for the tips!  I just tried  #1 hoping that was the magic trick but still the same result.

I'm not currently including the module in a template.  Rather, I'm just drag-n-dropping it into a page via the CMS which will largely be how it's used.
oof you might have to rename the module then
<@U3T21PDBK> That was one of the first things I did. Super weird issue.
Ha i’ve been presented with plenty of opportunities to give something a “better name” in HubSpot. Hopefully it gets sorted out though
